sentences.en: At last, a sudden recollection seemed to flash upon him.
sentences.cn: 最后, 他似乎恍然大悟.

sentences.en: He has a talent for recollection and anecdote.
sentences.cn: 他在记忆力和讲述趣闻轶事方面颇具天赋。

sentences.en: Her cheek burned at the recollection.
His recollection of the campaign is not too clear.
sentences.cn: 他对竞选的记忆不是那么清楚.

sentences.en: I have a very sharp recollection of my last talk with him two years ago.
sentences.cn: 两年前我和他最后一次谈话的情景仍历历在目.

sentences.en: I have absolutely no recollection of the incident.
sentences.cn: 我对那件事一点儿也记不起来了.

sentences.en: My earliest recollections are of my mother bending over my cot.
sentences.cn: 我最早的记忆是母亲俯身站在我的小床前。

sentences.en: Numberless recent massacres were still vivid in their recollection.
sentences.cn: 近来那些不可胜数的屠杀,在他们的头脑中记忆犹新.

sentences.en: Overcooked greens are my most vivid recollection of school dinners.
sentences.cn: 在我对学校午餐的回忆中，印象最深刻的就是蔬菜总是炒过头。

sentences.en: She had a sudden burst of recollection and had to share it with me.
sentences.cn: 她突然记起了很多事情，要与我分享。

sentences.en: Suddenly his mind filled with the recollection of a song she used to sing.
sentences.cn: 突然，他记起了一首她过去经常唱的歌。
追忆往事,使他的眼睛都亮了.

sentences.en: The recollection loosened a throng of benumbed sensations.
sentences.cn: 往日的回忆使已麻木的各种感觉一同涌上心头.

sentences.en: The rest of the half - year is a jumble in my recollection.
sentences.cn: 这半年里,其余的日子,在我的日子里,只是一片混乱.

sentences.en: We become aware of these ideas through recollection or anamnesis.
sentences.cn: 我们是通过前世回忆而体会到这些概念的.

trans.tran_cn: 回忆，追忆，往事，回忆录，[宗]冥想
trans.tran_en: something from the past that you remember
